repos.name: orchestrator
repos.description: A lightweight bash autonomous coding agents orchestrator.
repos.summary: A lightweight bash-based orchestrator that manages autonomous coding agent workflows by routing tasks from a YAML source of truth to specialized agent profiles (Claude, Codex, or OpenCode), with support for task delegation and execution tracking. Tasks progress through states from creation through routing and execution, with agents spawned via CLI tools in full agentic mode with tool access. The system includes configuration management, skill catalog integration, and persistent context tracking across execution runs.

repos.name: skills
repos.description: A collection of independent, self-contained skills for AI agents.
repos.summary: A collection of independent, self-contained skills for AI agents that follows the Agent Skills open standard, with each skill living in its own directory and configured via environment variables. Skills work across multiple agent platforms including Claude Code, Codex, and OpenClaw, and can be installed and configured using an interactive setup script that handles dependencies and API key management. The repository emphasizes security by requiring users to review skill code before installation and providing gitignored environment variable management.

repos.name: claudio
repos.description: Personal clawdbot with memory, subagents, cron schedules, projects and configurations.

repos.name: homebrew-tap
repos.description: Homebrew tap for orchestrator

repos.name: smart-money-concepts
repos.description: A TypeScript implementation of Smart Money Concepts (SMC) / ICT methodology for market structure analysis. Detects order blocks, fair value gaps, breaks of structure, changes of character, liquidity grabs, and more.
repos.summary: A TypeScript library that detects Smart Money Concepts and ICT market structure patterns like order blocks, fair value gaps, and breaks of structure by processing OHLCV candle data with zero runtime dependencies. It provides real-time alerts for trading signals and current market state analysis including trend bias, price zones, and Wyckoff phase detection. Users can feed candles individually for live streaming or process historical data in bulk for backtesting.

repos.name: meshbot
repos.description: Friendly bot that can autonomously handle tasks or delegate to its smarter friends.
repos.summary: Multi-agent orchestration platform that autonomously handles tasks or delegates to specialized agents through workflow chains, parallel execution, and dynamic agent creation. Built on pi libraries with support for scheduled tasks, queue management, and integration with Telegram and Discord channels. Includes persistence via file or SQLite, agent-to-agent routing, and subagent-style isolated execution modes.

repos.name: content-course
repos.description: Content Course landing page with Stripe & Solana payments
repos.summary: A high-converting landing page for selling digital courses with both Stripe and Solana payment integration built on Nuxt.js 3. It features responsive design optimized for conversions, accepting payments via credit card ($97) or SOL tokens (~1 SOL), with optional Supabase integration for course access management. The project includes complete setup instructions, deployment guidance for Vercel, and security best practices for payment processing.

repos.name: portfolio-guardian-saas
repos.description: Portfolio Guardian SaaS - Monitor your Solana portfolio 24/7 with AI-powered insights
repos.summary: A full-stack SaaS application built with Nuxt.js and Supabase that monitors Solana crypto portfolios with real-time balance tracking, P&L reporting, and AI-powered alerts. It features wallet integration, position tracking via Drift, subscription-based pricing tiers, and Telegram notifications for portfolio changes. The platform supports OAuth authentication and is designed for deployment on Vercel with comprehensive dashboard analytics and multi-wallet management capabilities.

repos.name: quant
repos.summary: A quantitative analysis toolkit or framework for financial modeling and data processing. The project provides utilities for numerical computations and statistical analysis in financial contexts.

repos.name: mind
repos.description: mind palace / writing / notes

repos.name: bot
repos.summary: A TypeScript trading bot for cryptocurrency markets that uses CCXT for real-time market data and supports multiple technical analysis strategies including SMA crossover, RSI, MACD, Bollinger Bands, SuperTrend, and Smart Money Concepts analysis. The framework provides flexible strategy combination, signal generation, and trade execution across different exchanges and protocols, configured via YAML with automated backtesting capabilities.

repos.name: portfolio
repos.description: Portfolio Manager with multiple strategies with backtests, allocation checks + warning, suggestions for increase/decrease/exit/hedge positions. Deploy strategy using Docker. Built with rust with main focus execution on Solana, using Perps, borrow/lend and yield protocols.
repos.summary: A Rust-based portfolio manager that executes multiple trading strategies on Solana using perpetual futures, lending protocols, and yield farming with integrated backtesting, position allocation validation, and automated suggestions for adjusting or hedging positions. The system includes warning mechanisms for allocation violations and supports containerized deployment via Docker for production execution.

repos.name: passive-trading
repos.summary: A cryptocurrency trading bot written in Python and Rust that operates on perpetual futures markets across multiple exchanges by automatically creating and cancelling limit orders as a contrarian market maker. It uses a Martingale-inspired strategy with grid-based entries, trailing orders, and an unstucking mechanism to manage positions, and includes a backtester and optimizer for strategy refinement.

repos.name: solana-vault-example
repos.description: A minimal Solana-based tokenized vault implementation that accepts user deposits, mints vault shares (ERC-4626 style), and enables authorized investment into third-party protocols via Cross-Program Invocation (CPI)
repos.summary: A Solana-based tokenized vault implementation that enables users to deposit SPL tokens, receive vault shares following ERC-4626 exchange rate mechanics, and allows authorized accounts to invest assets into external protocols via Cross-Program Invocation. The system uses SPL Token for vault assets and SPL Token-2022 for share tokens, with support for multiple protocol integrations through a registry-based adapter pattern.

repos.name: home
repos.description: Home Containers
repos.summary: A collection of containerized services for running a home server infrastructure. Manages multiple services in isolated Docker containers for simplified deployment and maintenance of self-hosted applications.

repos.name: private
repos.summary: A collection of utilities for managing privacy and backup operations. Provides tools and workflows for secure data protection and system backup management. Designed to handle encryption, file management, and data preservation tasks.

repos.name: trader-smith
repos.summary: A modular autonomous trading agent for Hyperliquid perpetual futures featuring advanced market-making strategies, multi-layer risk management, and real-time monitoring dashboards. The v2.0 architecture provides clean separation of concerns with comprehensive error handling, type safety, and sophisticated position controls for sophisticated traders managing algorithmic trading operations.

repos.name: lulo-cpi-example
repos.description: Lulo Example CPI Integration
repos.summary: Solana program demonstrating user vault integration with Lulo protocol via CPI, allowing users to deposit tokens, transfer to Lulo for yield generation, and withdraw with fallback async request handling if vault liquidity is insufficient. Users can deposit and withdraw from personal vaults while program admins can manage protocol reserves and coordinate token transfers through cross-program invocations.

repos.name: bliv
repos.summary: A Solana-based DeFi protocol that enables users to liberate and optimize yields across decentralized finance applications. The project includes an Anchor smart contract backend, a Next.js frontend application, and a CLI tool for interacting with the protocol, with a local validator setup for development and testing.

repos.name: bean
repos.description: Personal (or not) finance, accounting, defi/quant investments, projects and ideas.
repos.summary: A personal finance and quantitative investing platform combining plain text accounting via Beancount with stock screening and portfolio analysis tools. It integrates financial transaction imports from multiple data sources, implements factor-based ranking systems for Brazilian and US markets, and provides Jupyter notebooks for investment analysis. The project aims to automate accounting workflows and develop quantitative investment strategies through data analysis and risk metrics.

repos.name: mev
repos.summary: A Rust-based starter template for building MEV bots on Solana that leverages Jito's searcher and geyser infrastructure. It provides pre-configured dependencies and protobufs for common tools like Raydium, Orca, and Jito bundles, eliminating boilerplate setup. Included is an example backrun arbitrage bot that identifies profitable trades in the mempool and executes circular arbitrage strategies across multiple DEX platforms.

repos.name: defi-automator
repos.description: Manage your DeFi like a quant fund
repos.summary: A TypeScript application that automates DeFi portfolio management on Solana's Orca Whirlpools by creating positions based on algorithmic strategies, automatically rebalancing them, and collecting fees and rewards. Currently supports "One Tick Lower" and "One Tick Upper" strategies that initialize positions out-of-range to optimize yield capture as prices move. The project is still in early development and requires Node 16, Yarn, Solana CLI, and MongoDB to run.

repos.name: solana-nft-marketplace
repos.description: NFT marketplace contract on Solana
repos.summary: A Solana NFT marketplace contract built with Anchor 0.18.2 that enables users to list, update, and cancel NFT listings, as well as purchase NFTs with automatic marketplace fee and royalty distribution. Originally developed for a 2021 hackathon, the contract may contain outdated patterns and dependencies requiring modernization.

repos.name: partners
repos.summary: PHP project for managing partners with a feature test suite for a PartnerController, runnable via PHPUnit from the vendor directory.

repos.name: classification
repos.summary: A Laravel-based system for classifying company attributes that uses an AttributionClassifier to analyze and categorize company data, with the classification logic organized through a Company model and accompanying test suite.

repos.name: gabrielkoerich
repos.summary: A GitHub profile README for gabrielkoerich, a software engineer with 17+ years of experience specializing in Rust and Solana smart contracts, currently architecting DeFi protocols at Lulo. The profile highlights expertise in financial systems, previous entrepreneurial success with Bulldesk, and a passion for solving real-world problems through technology.

repos.name: report
repos.summary: A PHP project that provides reporting functionality, built with Composer for dependency management and MySQL for data persistence. It includes a test suite run via PHPUnit and requires environment configuration through a .env file. The project follows standard Laravel/PHP application setup patterns with database initialization and dependency installation steps.

repos.name: bulldesk-gridsome
repos.summary: A Gridsome starter project that combines Vue.js, GraphQL, and Bootstrap to generate static websites with built-in CMS integration through Forestry.io, Netlify deployment, and markdown-based content management. It includes features like Google Analytics, sitemap generation, and Netlify forms, designed to be deployed without requiring paid hosting or subscriptions. The project is configured for automatic deployment when code is pushed to GitHub.

repos.name: granatum-php
repos.description: A PHP 7+ library for the Granatum API.
repos.summary: A PHP 7+ library that provides integration with the Granatum financial API. It enables developers to programmatically interact with Granatum's financial services and data through a clean PHP interface. The library simplifies API communication for PHP-based applications requiring Granatum accounting and financial management functionality.

repos.name: cross-domain
repos.summary: A lightweight PHP micro-framework for building fast web applications with an expressive syntax. Lumen simplifies common development tasks like routing, database abstraction, queueing, and caching. It's designed to provide an enjoyable development experience while maintaining high performance for web projects.

repos.name: guidelines
repos.description: My PHP, HTML, CSS and Javascript guidelines.
repos.summary: A repository documenting coding standards and best practices for PHP, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development. It establishes guidelines for version control workflows, naming conventions, indentation standards, and language-specific coding styles including PSR-2 compliance for PHP and semantic HTML structure. The project enforces consistent code quality through documented requirements for pull requests, documentation blocks, and file organization across multiple technologies.

repos.name: iafut-backend
repos.summary: A PHP archetype project built with the Slim framework, Twig templating, Eloquent ORM, and Phinx migrations, designed as a base template for TodoBit's PHP projects and configured to run in Vagrant with VirtualBox. It provides a quick development setup with pre-configured database management, PSR-4 class structure conventions, and automated migrations and seeding capabilities accessible via localhost:8080.

repos.name: dotfiles
repos.description: Gabriel's config files (zsh, tmux, git, etc) + backups, brew installs, coding agents and macOS setup.
repos.summary: Personal dotfiles repository for macOS configuration management, featuring shell setup (zsh, tmux, neovim), app settings synchronization via mackup, and installation scripts for dependencies, fonts, and development tools. Includes tooling for coding agents (codex, claude, opencode), security hardening templates, and a justfile-based command runner for managing system setup, syncing configs, and restoring app settings across machines.

repos.name: addressing
repos.description: Brazilian postalcode to address in a service manager.
repos.summary: A service that converts Brazilian postal codes to full addresses. It provides a simple interface for looking up address information based on CEP (postal code) numbers in Brazil.

repos.name: service-manager
repos.description: A simple way to run services in sequence.
repos.summary: A simple manager that runs services in sequence, providing an organized way to orchestrate multiple services with a straightforward interface. Licensed under the MIT License and built by Gabriel Koerich as a utility for service orchestration workflows.

repos.name: algorit
repos.description: WIP
repos.summary: A web application combining a Vue.js frontend with Laravel Elixir build tooling and Sass/Pug templating, paired with a PHP Lumen backend API. The project uses modern frontend tooling including Gulp for asset compilation while maintaining a lightweight PHP microframework architecture on the server side.

repos.name: gabrielkoerich.github.io
repos.description: Projects & Work

repos.name: cashier-iugu
repos.description: Iugu integration for Laravel Cashier

repos.name: basedash
repos.summary: A PHP-based web application that provides a dashboard interface built with Laravel, Node.js, and front-end tooling for managing and viewing data. The project uses Composer for PHP dependencies, npm and Bower for JavaScript packages, and Grunt for asset building, with support for database migrations and seeding through Artisan commands.

repos.name: algorit.com.br
repos.summary: A website or web application for algorit.com.br with no additional context provided in the available documentation.

repos.name: bovespa.io
repos.description: bovespa.io
repos.summary: A Laravel-based web application for managing and analyzing stock market data from Bovespa (Brazilian stock exchange) with a frontend built using npm, Bower, and Gulp. The project includes comprehensive testing via PHPUnit with code coverage reporting, and follows a standard development workflow with Composer for PHP dependencies and database migrations/seeding.
